name: hello-app-pg55f
description: Simple hello world app with k6 load generation

costEstimate.note: Rough estimate based on on-demand GCE pricing; actual cost may differ.

analysis.summary: The hello-app-pg55f experiment ran for 691.7 seconds (11.5 minutes) on a single GKE cluster target named 'app'. The validation workflow succeeded in 20 seconds. Total estimated cost was $0.0038, indicating a lightweight deployment suitable for demo purposes.

metricInsights.cpu_usage: CPU usage metric tracks the total core consumption rate across containers tagged with this experiment, providing insight into compute resource demands during the load generation phase.
metricInsights.memory_usage: Memory working set metric monitors the total active memory footprint in bytes, helping identify memory pressure and right-sizing opportunities for the hello-world application.

recommendations: Consider collecting actual metric values (currently only query definitions are present) to enable quantitative performance analysis
Add response time and error rate metrics from the k6 load generator to assess application performance under load
Extend experiment duration beyond 11.5 minutes to capture steady-state behavior and identify potential resource leaks
